intro: Ardisia fuscopilosa, commonly known as the dark-pelted ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The botanical features of Ardisia fuscopilosa make it a valuable component of tropical ecosystems.
